alert.note: Alert for Ashland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 1:19AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...Southern portions of Ashland County Ohio. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding along the Black Fork of the Mohincan River in Loudonville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 117 AM EST, gauge reports indicated minor flooding was ongoing along the Black Fork of the Mohican River near Loudonville. Flooding of other low lying or poor drainage areas is also possible. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Loudonville and Perrysville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
